title: Automated Classification of Phonetic Segments in Child Speech Using Raw Ultrasound Imaging
abstract: arXiv:2402.17482v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: Speech sound disorder (SSD) is defined as a persistent impairment in speech sound production leading to reduced speech intelligibility and hindered verbal communication. Early recognition and intervention of children with SSD and timely referral to speech and language therapists (SLTs) for treatment are crucial. Automated detection of speech impairment is regarded as an efficient method for examining and screening large populations. This study focuses on advancing the automatic diagnosis of SSD in early childhood by proposing a technical solution that integrates ultrasound tongue imaging (UTI) with deep-learning models. The introduced FusionNet model combines UTI data with the extracted texture features to classify UTI. The overarching aim is to elevate the accuracy and efficiency of UTI analysis, particularly for classifying speech sounds associated with SSD. translated_title: 使用原始超声波成像技术自动分类儿童语音中的音素片段
translated_abstract: 语音障碍（SSD）被定义为语音产生的持续障碍，导致语音可理解性降低，阻碍言语交流。本文专注于通过提出一种技术解决方案，将超声舌头成像（UTI）与深度学习模型相结合，推进对幼儿期SSD的自动诊断。引入的FusionNet模型将UTI数据与提取的纹理特征结合起来，用于对UTI进行分类，旨在提高UTI分析的准确性和效率。
tldr: 通过将超声舌头成像与深度学习模型相结合，提出了一种自动识别幼儿期语音障碍的技术解决方案，旨在提高UTI分析的准确性和效率。
en_tdlr: A technical solution for automatic identification of speech sound disorders in early childhood is proposed by integrating ultrasound tongue imaging with deep-learning models, aiming to enhance the accuracy and efficiency of UTI analysis.
